com.esri.mo2.src.file
Class FileSystemSource

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.src.sys.BaseSource
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.src.file.FileSystemSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
Source
public class FileSystemSource
extends BaseSource
implements Source

This Source provides access to the Content found in the local file system. The root Folders provided by getRoots() each represent a local disk drive.

getContent

public Content getContent(String path)
                   throws IOException
over-rides the getContent method from BaseSource by introducing a test for Windows, to handle paths that may be relative to the "current" disk that is defined within System.getProperty("user.dir"). Thus. on WIndows, if the given path lacks a Windows drive identifier, the drive is assumed to be the same as the "current" directory.

The path is parsed by getContentForPath which allows the use of either "/" or "\" separators.

Specified by:
getContent in interface Source
Overrides:
getContent in class BaseSource
Parameters:
path - a file system path
Returns:
the Content found, or null == the path does not exist
Throws:
IOException - if any problem occurs while visiting the parent Folder/s of the desired Content

getRoots

public Content[] getRoots()
                   throws IOException
produces one or more Folders representing each of the local disk drives

Specified by:
getRoots in interface Source
Returns:
one or more Content objects corresponding to the top-level Contents of this Connection, or null == path not found or not connected
IOException

             throws IOException

refresh

public void refresh()
             throws IOException
Description copied from interface: Source

disconnect

public void disconnect()
                throws IOException
Description copied from interface: Source
by invoking this method you cause the connection to release all underlying resources. You can subsequently re-connect by invoking connect().
